CONCLUSION: No violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture (Article 3 - Degrading treatment;Inhuman treatment) (Substantive aspect);No violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture (Article 3 - Effective investigation) (Procedural aspect)
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Elisabeth Steiner;Julia Laffranque;Khanlar Hajiyev;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . During TIME of DATE the applicant assaulted PERSON in an attempt to steal her handbag . After searching the surrounding streets , PERSON and her acquaintance , PERSON . , located the applicant at a bus stop nearby .

CARDINAL . As quoted in the report of the internal security office of ORG of LOC of DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , police officers PERSON , who arrived at the scene after a telephone call from PERSON , stated that when they arrived they saw that the applicant ’s head had been bleeding and his jacket was torn . They handcuffed him when he attempted to escape .

CARDINAL . After taking the applicant to NORP police station , the police officers called an ambulance which took him to a hospital for first aid to be administered . Afterwards he was taken back to the police station and released on DATE after questioning .

CARDINAL . On DATE criminal proceedings were instituted by the investigative department of NORP police station against the applicant in connection with the incident of DATE . On DATE the investigator drew up a record of the inspection of PERSON handbag describing its appearance and contents which included a cell phone and a certain amount of money . The record also included an estimate of the cost of the objects . CARDINAL attesting witnesses , P. and PERSON , put their signatures on the record of inspection and on the decision of the same date to include in the body of evidence the above - mentioned objects .
CARDINAL . The records of the questioning of PERSON and PERSON . of DATE contain the following identical statements :

“ [ The applicant ] tried to run away but PERSON . stopped him and grabbed his arms . [ The applicant ] made several other attempts at absconding before the arrival of the police , which is why PERSON . had to physically restrain him , and that might have caused some bodily injury ... Upon their arrival the police handcuffed [ the applicant ] . ”
CARDINAL . When being questioned on DATE as a suspect , the applicant stated the following :

“ The woman pushed me in the chest , and the man hit me on the head with the handle of a handgun , causing bleeding ... The woman walked to a nearby shopping centre and returned with CARDINAL security guards , after which the CARDINAL men started beating me . Then the woman used her mobile phone to call the police ... I was then taken to NORP police station where I was handcuffed to the iron bar of a cell .

In the questioning office ... I was told to sit down on the floor . On several occasions I tried to get up and the police officer took a truncheon and hit me across the legs . The other police officers started mocking me and told me to sing [ a children ’s song ] to identify my voice , which I did as I feared that I would be subjected to physical violence . ”
CARDINAL . On DATE an expert forensic report concluded that he suffered from “ shift - like ” schizophrenia with pronounced psychological effects .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of GPE ( “ the ORG ” ) , while considering the criminal charge against the applicant , refused a request by the applicant ’s counsel to summon the attesting witnesses PERSON and PERSON , who were allegedly ex - police officers , for lack of sufficient grounds to question their identity . Counsel further demanded that the signed documents be struck out of the list of evidence as they were improperly drawn up . This request was also dismissed as the court held that the documents had been drawn up in accordance with the law .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found that the applicant had committed attempted robbery with assault , but relieved him of criminal liability on account of his mental - health status and ordered his placement in a psychiatric hospital . The court based its conclusion on the statements of PERSON and PERSON . made in court , as well as various procedural documents , including the record of inspection of PERSON belongings and the decision to include the objects in the body of evidence signed by the attesting witnesses . It also referred to the statement made by the applicant ’s mother , who acted as his lawful representative , to the effect that the applicant had been beaten up by strangers who had subsequently turned him in to the police .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) upheld the above - mentioned decision on appeal .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s mother complained to the prosecutor of GPE of GPE , requesting the opening of criminal proceedings in connection with the applicant ’s alleged ill - treatment in custody . On an unspecified date her complaint was referred by the prosecutor to the internal security office of ORG of LOC for an inquiry .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant went to a municipal hospital which recorded multiple bruises on his head , neck and torso , and an abrasion on the back of his head .
CARDINAL . On DATE he attended at another hospital which recorded an infected wound on his head and hypoesthesia of the fingers of the right hand .
CARDINAL . Both records contain the following references :
“ According to the [ applicant ] , on DATE he was beaten up by the officers of NORP police station ” .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigator in charge of the applicant ’s criminal case commissioned an expert forensic report on account of the applicant ’s allegations of ill - treatment made in the course of the criminal investigation against him . In his order he indicated that the experts should examine the available medical documents . He also referred the complaint of ill - treatment for examination to the prosecutor ’s office of GPE of GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the internal security office of ORG of LOC completed the inquiry prompted by the applicant ’s mother ’s complaint , producing a report of DATE . In particular , the inquiring officer stated as follows :

“ Police officers PERSON and PERSON questioned in the course of the inquiry stated that they had put handcuffs on [ the applicant ] as during the apprehension the latter had put up resistance and had tried to hit PERSON
The above - mentioned officers also stated that when they had discovered that [ the applicant ] had a head injury , they called an ambulance after escorting [ the applicant ] to the police station .
After [ the applicant ] was administered medical aid at GPE municipal hospital no . CARDINAL , he was again brought to NORP police station .
Duty officer PERSON . and investigator PERSON stated that there had been no unlawful actions during [ the applicant ’s ] apprehension and questioning .
Thus , the allegations of unlawful actions by police officers were not proved during the inquiry , and the use of handcuffs was not in breach of LAW .

However , given that the complaint refers to unlawful actions by police officers which fall within the competence of the prosecutor ’s office , [ I ] suggest terminating the internal inquiry , sending the material collected by the internal inquiry to the LOC prosecutor ’s office for taking a decision in accordance with the law , and informing the parties concerned about the decision . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG forensic experts issued a conclusion which reiterated the medical data as described above ( see paragraphs CARDINAL and CARDINAL above ) and stated that the recorded injuries had not led to any consequences for the applicant ’s health . The experts could not determine the circumstances or the date of the injuries due to the lack of comprehensive data .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor of the Cheremushkinskiy District of GPE , relying on the statements made by police officers PERSON . in the context of the investigation by the internal security office , decided not to institute criminal proceedings in respect of the applicant ’s alleged ill - treatment .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant , his mother and counsel challenged the above decision in court .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG heard the applicant ’s mother , his counsel and a representative of the prosecutor ’s office and dismissed the complaint as unfounded after concluding that the applicant ’s injuries had been caused by the third parties who had restrained him at the scene . In particular , the court said :

“ As follows from the statements given by PERSON , PERSON . and police officers PERSON , at the moment of the arrest [ the applicant ] ... had injuries which had occurred before arrival of the police . [ The applicant ’s mother ] ... also confirmed at the hearing that her son had been beaten up with a handgun before arrival of the officers of NORP police station . ”
